content: अर्क {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [अर्च्-घञ्-कुत्वं <ls>Uṇ. 3. 40</ls>] Fit to be worshipped (अर्चंनीय). --र्कः {@--1@} A ray of light, a flash of lightning (<ab>Ved.</ab>). {@--2@} The sun; आविष्कृतारुणपुरःसर एकतोर्कः <ls>Ś. 4. 1.</ls> {@--3@} Fire. {@--4@} A crystal. {@--5@} Copper. {@--6@} Sunday. {@--7@} Membrum virile. {@--8@} <ab>N.</ab> of the sun-plant, Calatropis Gigantea (<ab>Mar.</ab> रुई), a small tree with medicinal sap and rind; अर्कस्योपरि शिथिलं च्युतमिव नवमल्लिकाकुसुमं <ls>Ś. 2. 8</ls>; यमाश्रित्य न विश्रामं क्षुधार्ता यांति सेवकाः . सोऽर्कवन्नृपतिस्त्याज्यः सदापुष्पफलोऽपि सन् <ls>Pt. 1. 51.</ls> {@--9@} <ab>N.</ab> of Indra. {@--10@} A sort of religious ceremony. {@--11@} Praise, hymn; praising, extolling, song of praise. {@--12@} A singer (<ab>Ved.</ab> in these two senses). {@--13@} A learned man. {@--14@} An elder brother. {@--15@} Food (अर्कं also). {@--16@} <ab>N.</ab> of Viṣṇu. {@--17@} A kind of decoction. {@--18@} The seventh day of a month. {@--19@} The उत्तरफल्गुनी asterism. {@--20@} The number 12.
